intro: Columbia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes columbia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swampy areas. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes other well-known plants like philodendrons and calla lilies. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
